form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: APPLICATION FOR A NEW NATURALIZATION OR CITIZENSHIP, N-565

full_text: Screened by NARA, 6/28/2023 CB N-565 Form approved Budget Bureau No. 43-R099.7 No A10-179-2788 C:61 APPLICATION FOR A NEW NATURALIZATION OR CITIZENSHIP PAPER 3/18/63 (See Instructions on Reverse) Take or mail to $5.00 FFE PAID No. 171-34 IMMIGRATION AND INATURALIZATION SERVICE, Immigration Service U. S. COURT HOUSE BUFFALO 2, N. Y. Date 3/14/63 up I hereby apply for a new naturalization or citizenship paper. (1) (a) My full, true name is YEN MEI-LING TUAN (b) The name under which I was naturalized is YEN MEI-LING TUAN (c) Other cames I have used are Mei-ling Yen Tuan (2) I was born at Ankiu, Shantung, China on March 16, 1901 (City or town) (3) I arrived in the United States at San Francisco, California (Gountry) (Month) (Day) (Year) on May 23, 1955 (City or town) (State) (Month) (Day) (Year) (4) I now reside at 319 Bedford Avenue, Buffalo 16. Erie, New York (Number and street) (City or town) (Country) (State) (5) My personal description is: Sex Female color of eyes Brown color of hair Gray complexion me Ling med, ; height 50 feet 1 inches; weight 135 pounds; visible distinctive marks Wearing farsighted glasses marital status Married MeiLung none country of which I was a citizen, subject, or national China (6) The naturalization or citizenship paper was issued to me by U. S. District 93 3 Court (Name of court) at Peoria Peoria Illinois on September 12 1961 (City or town) (County) (State) (Month) (Day) (Year) (7) Since my naturalization or repatriation, I have not lost my citizenship in any manner (8) Since the date the naturalization or citizenship paper was issued to me I have not been absent from the United States for more than six months, except as follows: DEPARTED FROM THE UNITED STATES RETURNED TO THE UNITED STATE SS Date Vessel, or Other Means Port Date (Month, day, year) Vessel, or Other Means of Conveyance Port (Month, day, year) of Conv√©yance 26 1963 lost (9) Such paper became mutilated on or about August 20-31 at Macomb deotroyed (Month) (Day) (Year) (City McDonough, Illinois under the following circumstances: State or country) When we were moving our home from Macomb, Ill. to Buffalo, N. Y.; packing our baggages, clearing our house, the citizenship paper might be mixed up with other papers, we thought useless, and burned. Answer (10) Only if You Are Applying For a New Paper in a Changed Name. (10) My name was changed by (a) Marriage; from the name of to (Name naturalized under) (Present married name) at on (City or town) (County) (State) (Date) (b) Decree of Court, at (City or town) on (County) (State) (Month) (Day) (Year) I certify that the above statements are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and belief. ER yun Mei-Ling Juan (Complete signature of applicant) 319 Bedford Ave., Buffalo 16, New York Form N-565 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE (Address at which applicant receives mail) Immigration and Naturalization Service signature (Rev. 12-1-59) N570(6)
